channel.title: Proprioception
channel.description:
How can I become more aware of my body's limits, such as reach and strength? Does anyone have personal experience with this, or with the Alexander Technique, which the Wikipedia article mentions.
I know some people can easily pick up a technique, such as a volleyball overhand serve, just through watching, because they are aware of the position of their arms through each part of the serve. They can replicate what they see easily. Has anyone observed this?

On topic, how far have you gotten in that?
[/quote]
reguarding me in a marathon?
I’ve never actually ran in one yet, but my projected time is around 3:07[/quote]
Oh oaky, good luck in March

On topic, how far have you gotten in that?

item.title: Proprioception
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Well this will probably sound pretty stupid, but the way I find my limits is by testing them. Like to see how far I can go on my bike, I ride till I’m thoroughly exhausted, then I have to scrounge energy to get back home. Or, for something like how many sit ups, I just keep it up till my body can’t handle anymore. Probably there are much better ways, but this works for me.

Read full topic
